data.question: What is the chemical formula for CPM-99Fe?
data.answer: C216H130N12O35Fe3Cl3Zr6

data.question: Which CPM-99 derivative exhibits the highest ORR activity?
data.answer: CPM-99Fe/C exhibits the best ORR activity.

data.question: What is the role of Zr6-polyoxo-cluster in CPM-99X?
data.answer: Zr6-polyoxo-cluster in CPM-99X serves as the hard template to impede the agglomeration of the resulting electrocatalytic nanofragments and helps create the nanoscale cavity upon removal by acid wash.

data.question: How does the presence of metalloporphyrin centers in CPM-99 materials influence their properties?
data.answer: The nature of porphyrinic-metal sites greatly influence their ORR catalytic properties.

data.question: True or False: CPM-99Fe/C is more durable and methanol-tolerant than the benchmark 20% Pt/C.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the BET surface area of CPM-99Fe after pyrolysis at 700°C?
data.answer: The BET surface area of CPM-99Fe/C after pyrolysis at 700°C is 399 m2 g–1.

data.question: What synthesis method is used for the CPM-99 series?
data.answer: Solvothermal reactions are used for the synthesis of the CPM-99 series.

data.question: True or False: The CPM-99 materials retain their microcubic morphology after carbonization.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of carbonization temperature on the ORR activity of CPM-99Fe?
data.answer: The optimum annealing temperature for the highest ORR activity of CPM-99Fe/C is found to be 700 °C.

data.question: True or False: The transferred electron number per O2 molecule for CPM-99Fe/C in acidic medium is calculated to be 4.0(±0.1).
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the crystal system of CPM-99Fe?
data.answer: The crystal system of CPM-99Fe is cubic.

data.question: True or False: The porosity of CPM-99 materials is examined by nitrogen adsorption at 77 K.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of benzoic acid in the synthesis of CPM-99?
data.answer: Benzoic acid is used in the solvothermal reaction mixture for the synthesis of CPM-99 series.

data.question: True or False: The CPM-99 series can be made with or without secondary metal ions.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the ftw topology in CPM-99?
data.answer: The ftw topology in CPM-99 allows for the avoidance of interpenetration while retaining high stability.

data.question: True or False: The CPM-99 series exhibits a binodal cubic net composed of 12-connected Zr6O4(OH)4 cuboctahedra linked by longer tetrakis­(4-carboxybiphenyl)­porphyrin (TCBPP).
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of the molecular-configuration-guided strategy on the synthesis of CPM-99?
data.answer: The molecular-configuration-guided strategy leads to the successful implementation of zirconium-carboxylate frameworks with cubic 2.5 nm cage in CPM-99.

data.question: True or False: The pyrolytic products of CPM-99 retain the porphyrinic active sites.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of the hard-templating effect of Zr6-polyoxo-cluster in CPM-99?
data.answer: The hard-templating effect of Zr6-polyoxo-cluster in CPM-99 endows it with highly desirable properties as precursors for oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) catalysts.

data.question: True or False: CPM-99Fe/C exhibits ORR activity comparable to the commercial benchmark 20% Pt/C in both alkaline and acidic media.
data.answer: True
